meanings.definition: To possess or dominate mentally before, in advance, or in anticipation.
meanings.sent1: She was prepossessed with the idea of winning the competition.
meanings.sent2: He always prepossesses the outcome of the game in his mind.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed prepossessed with catching the elusive red dot.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was prepossessed by thoughts of the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house prepossessed a sense of fear in all who entered.

meanings.definition: To influence beforehand or prejudice in favor of something.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement prepossessed her to try the new product.
meanings.sent2: His previous experiences prepossessed him to trust strangers.
meanings.sent3: The magician prepossessed the audience with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent4: The biased article prepossessed readers against the opposing viewpoint.
meanings.sent5: The enchanting melody prepossessed everyone at the concert.
